c74object.name: ibufconcatedrive~
c74object.description: The ibufconcatedrive~ object is high resolution drive object (accumulator) that is internally clipped according to the given items (or chunks) associated with a buffer (items are stored using the ibufconcatenate~ object). Typically this object forms part of a sample-accurate sampler or granulator, and is used in conjunction with play~ (or historically hr.play~). By use of this system (first concatentating samples, then referencing them in this way) it is possible to cleanly and accurately switch between the contents of the source buffers in a sample-accurate manner. The speed input controls playback speed. The item input selects the item from those associated with the buffer (0 is no item / -1 is the whole buffer). When the reset trigger is non-zero the item input will be read, and the output will be set to the value specified at the reset value inlet (this should be given as the actual position into the buffer~ in ms, rather than relative to the item).

objarg.name: (i)buffer_name
objarg.description: The first argument is the ibuffer~ /buffer~ to attach to and ouput position data from.

objarg.name: initial_value
objarg.description:
Set the initial playback position.
Default is 0

method.name: signal
method.description:
In the first inlet: Set the playback speed multiplier.
In the second inlet: Set the item stored in ibufconcatenate~ to play.
In the third inlet: Set the start position in milliseconds to begin playback from when a reset trigger is received in the fourth inlet.
In the fourth inlet: A tigger signal will reset the playback position to the position set by the third inlet.

method.name: set
method.description: Set the ibuffer~ /buffer~ to attach to and ouput position data from.

entry.name: signal
entry.description:
The first outlet outputs the playback position as a signal for use in play.
The second outlet outputs hi-res position to work with hr.play~.
